ch.usz.c3pro.c3_pro_android_framework.questionnaire.logic

Class ConditionalOrderedTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.researchstack.backbone.task.Task
      • org.researchstack.backbone.task.OrderedTask
        • ch.usz.c3pro.c3_pro_android_framework.questionnaire.logic.ConditionalOrderedTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ConditionalOrderedTask
extends org.researchstack.backbone.task.OrderedTask
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class extends the ResearchStack OrderedTask and can display Steps as well as ConditionalSteps. ConditionalSteps can have ResultRequirements and are only shown to the user when all of them are met. The logic is derived from the FHIR Questionnaire.QuestionnaireItemEnableWhenComponent element.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConditionalOrderedTask

        public ConditionalOrderedTask(java.lang.String identifier,
                              java.util.List<org.researchstack.backbone.step.Step> steps)
        Consturctor. Returns an initialized ConditionalOrderedTask using the specified identifier and array of steps.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The unique identifier for the task. Should be identical to the the LinkId of the corresponding FHIR Questionnaire
        steps - An array of Steps and ConditionalSteps in the order in which they should be presented.

        Overrides:
        getStepAfterStep in class org.researchstack.backbone.task.OrderedTask
        Parameters:
        step - The reference step. Pass null to specify the first step.
        result - A snapshot of the current set of results.
        Returns:
        the next step in steps after the passed step that has all its requirements met by the provided TaskResult, or null if at the end
